Name: S3WebsiteRedirectRule
Documentation: The RedirectRule property is an embedded property of the Amazon S3 Website Configuration Routing Rules Property that describes how requests are redirected. In the event of an error, you can specify a different error code to return.

Parameters.Name: HostName
Parameters.Documentation: Name of the host where requests are redirected.

Parameters.Name: HttpRedirectCode
Parameters.Documentation: The HTTP redirect code to use on the response.

Parameters.Name: Protocol
Parameters.Documentation: The protocol to use in the redirect request.

Parameters.Name: ReplaceKeyPrefixWith
Parameters.Documentation:
The object key prefix to use in the redirect request. For example, to redirect requests for all pages with the prefix docs/ (objects in the docs/ folder) to the documents/ prefix, you can set the KeyPrefixEquals property in routing condition property to docs/, and set the ReplaceKeyPrefixWith property to documents/.
Important
If you specify this property, you cannot specify the ReplaceKeyWith property.

Parameters.Name: ReplaceKeyWith
Parameters.Documentation:
The specific object key to use in the redirect request. For example, redirect request to error.html.
Important
If you specify this property, you cannot specify the ReplaceKeyPrefixWith property.
